page.title: 08THE STANWAY-TOLLGATE AREA
page.content: At the edge of{Stanway}was a {roundabout}leading to the A12 with a few cottages and fields near it. Builders bought the land and put {houses}of brick,slate,plaster and wood on it - all different and not in rows. About one thousand people found homes here. Nearby exhausted gravel pits and fields were bought.{Bulldozers landscaped the area sheltering sites for factories. Trees were planted and a{community centre}opened. The buildings were designed in glass,steel and brick. Local people began to trade in children's clothes,gifts and joinery. There are plans for larger units. Sainsbury's are to build a{large store relieving traffic problems at their present site. In a few short years, {Stanway}has been enlarged quite a lot.
